moves.1. e4 d5 2. exd5 Nf6 3. d4 e6 4. dxe6 Bx: All theory till now, but this is not on my personal database... :-) I guess Qxd5 gives some tempoes in return to white, so the scope of my defence will be lost.
moves.6. Ne2 Nbd7 7. O-O Bd6: I am a little late - as always - with my queenside ideal castling.
moves.8. Bg5: This helps me in winning the needed tempo.
moves.8... h6 9. Bh4: True is that this B will block my attack on h2.
moves.9... Qc7 10. Bg3 O-O-O 11. Bxd6 Qxd6: A different asset from my usuals, which have both dsb, where mine is powerful. This is when I really start to think.
moves.12. Nd2: White has a lot of attacking moves. I have to find mine, or he will just walk all over me (c4, b4...)
moves.12... Ng4: He has to react, and probably open the white squares for my B.
moves.13. h3: ?? ...and, as often in blitzes, I lose the mate in one!
moves.14. hxg4 hxg4 15. Ng3 f5 16. Re1 f4: This was what I was looking for.
moves.18... g3: Only Ne4 stops the mate, but I have some other ideas...
moves.19. Bf3 gxf2+ 20. Nxf2: This is the moment: now, I can play Rh1+, KxR, QxNf2 and the threat is Rh8+. He has Bh5 as an in-extremis defence, so I have to be sure I'll have another resource, then I played...
moves.20... Bd5: With the Q on f2, if this B moves Qxg2#. White is +2, but he's suffering.
moves.21. c3 Rh1+ 22. Kxh1 Qxf2 23. Nf1: The only move that can save him, but only for few moves:
moves.25... Qxh2+ 26. Kf1: Here there is a single "killer move", and I missed it. Of course you can see it, it's a "quiet move"...
moves.26... Bc4+: No, not this one, but there is little difference.
moves.27. Be2 Qg3: White has no moves. My opp could have thought I was sadistic by not mating him when I could... It was not so!
